versos: (lent) Joel 2:12 - "Yet even now," declares the Lord, "return to me with all your heart, with fasting, with weeping, and with mourning.";;;
(mixed) There shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt
(hosts) Isaiah 1:9 - "Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.";;;
(sanctify) John 17:17 - "sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.";;;
(stony) Ezekiel 36:26 - "I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.";;;

(quarters) Ezekiel 41:3 - Then he went into the inner sanctuary and measured the jambs of the entrance; two cubits was the width of the entrance, and the six cubits was the width of the side walls of the entrance.;;;
(apart) Isaiah 59:2 - But your iniquities have separated you from your God; your sins have hidden his face from you, so that he will not hear.;;;
(repent) Acts 3:19 - "repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.";;;
(encamped) Numbers 2:2 - "The Israelites are to camp around the tent of meeting some distance from it, each of them under their standard and holding the banners of their family.";;;
(encamp) Exodus 14:20 - "It came between the Egyptian camp and the Israelite camp. The cloud was there in the darkness, but it lit up the night.";;;
(hamath) 2 Kings 17:24 - The king of Assyria brought people from Babylon
(serving) Matthew 20:28 - "just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.";;;
(graves) John 5:28 - "Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice.";;;
(camp) "Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palm trees, and they camped there by the water." - Exodus 15:27;;;
(wheels) "As for their rims, they were so high they were dreadful; and their rims were full of eyes, around all four of them." - Ezekiel 1:18;;;
(sang) Psalm 33:3 - "Sing to him a new song; play skillfully, and shout for joy.";;;
